definition: to have one's eyes on (a goal)/having sth in mind/to concentrate
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
place of interest/a place one has one's eye on
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: think of the big picture, start with the little things (idiom)
pinyin: da4 chu4 zhuo2 yan3 , xiao3 chu4 zhuo2 shou3

definition: to narrow one's eyes and gaze at something with great attention

sentences.english: I haven't done many portraits, but I could paint landscapes in my sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我画的肖像画不多，但是我闭着眼也能画风景。

sentences.english: But a focus exclusively on majors and job openings misses two key points.
sentences.chinese: 专门着眼于专业和职位的空缺漏掉了两个关键点。

sentences.english: She stared, colored, doubted, and was silent.
sentences.chinese: 她瞪着眼，红着脸，满腹狐疑，闭口不响。

sentences.english: Wang Fuzhi s Shuo Wen Guang Yi focuses on changes of morphology and semantic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 王夫之《说文广义》着眼词的形义变化。

sentences.english: I rub eyes, a beautiful wife in another sofa.
sentences.chinese: 我揉搓着眼，妻子张美丽就在另一个沙发上。

sentences.english: I close my eyes, grinding his teeth, waiting for the first beat down.
sentences.chinese: 我闭着眼，咬着牙，等着第一鞭打下来。

sentences.english: First, keep focused on the overall interests while adhering to principles.
sentences.chinese: 第一，要着眼大局，坚持原则。

sentences.english: We're going to look at what it meant in the first century.
sentences.chinese: 而是着眼于它在公元一世纪的意义。

sentences.english: A final chapter looks at possible future definitions of racial identity.
sentences.chinese: 最后一章着眼于未来可能出现的种族身份的定义。

sentences.english: Grandpa Hodge asked, narrowing his eyes.
Will you get wrinkles if you sleep with eye makeup?
sentences.chinese: 如果带着眼妆睡觉，会长皱纹么？

sentences.english: Grasp the basis of hazard prevention from the small office to pay attention to important points.
sentences.chinese: 抓基础从大处着眼，防隐患从小处着手。

sentences.english: Some advocates of the tax, however, eye broader benefits.
sentences.chinese: 然而，物业税的拥护者着眼于更宽的利益。

sentences.english: His eyes looking at the dark ceiling, not a little sleepy.
sentences.chinese: 睁着眼望着黑洞洞的天花板，没有一点睡意。

sentences.english: Most previous studies on Shao Yong's poetics are from the perspective of Li-Xue.
sentences.chinese: 以往对邵雍诗学的研究，多从理学角度着眼。

definition: to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
to watch sb closely/to breathe down sb's neck/to mark (sports)
